content: All the reagents were of AR grade and used without further purification. l-trp (1.0 mmol, 0.2043 g) was dissolved in methanol (10 mL) and stirred for 10 min at room temperature. Cadmium acetate dihydrate (0.5 mmol, 0.1337 g) was dissolved in methanol (10 mL) and added dropwise to the above solution for 0.5 h with stirring. The resulting mixture was put into a Teflon®-lined stainless steel autoclave (25 mL capacity) under autogenous pressure and heated to 165 °C for 72 h. The autoclave was then cooled to room temperature at a rate of 3.0 °C/h. Colorless rhombic sheet crystals suitable for X-ray crystallography were obtained; yield of 48%. The crystalline material is difficult to dissolve in water, methanol, ethanol, ether, acetonitrile, DMF or DMSO.
clean_text:
Experimental

Synthesis of [Cd(l-trp) (d-trp)]n

All the reagents were of AR grade and used without further purification. l-trp (1.0 mmol, 0.2043 g) was dissolved in methanol (10 mL) and stirred for 10 min at room temperature. Cadmium acetate dihydrate (0.5 mmol, 0.1337 g) was dissolved in methanol (10 mL) and added dropwise to the above solution for 0.5 h with stirring. The resulting mixture was put into a Teflon®-lined stainless steel autoclave (25 mL capacity) under autogenous pressure and heated to 165 °C for 72 h. The autoclave was then cooled to room temperature at a rate of 3.0 °C/h. Colorless rhombic sheet crystals suitable for X-ray crystallography were obtained; yield of 48%. The crystalline material is difficult to dissolve in water, methanol, ethanol, ether, acetonitrile, DMF or DMSO.
